The West Village: Embodied by exquisite prewar brownstones and romantic winding streets, the West Village i
properties.neighborhood_overview: The West Village: Embodied by exquisite prewar brownstones and romantic winding streets, the West Village is one of the most storied of all New York City neighborhoods. Don't be surprised to find yourself at the corner of Waverly Place and Waverly Place, or to cross West 4th at West 12th Street: many of its tree-lined streets were established well before the more common grid system that exists above 14th Street, and follow the old cattle and horse trails created by early West Village settlers. Some streets are still paved with cobblestones, like of West 11th and Bank Streets. Long associated with quaint shops, artists' studios, cafes and eateries of all flavors, the West Village is home to such local fixtures as the Waverly Inn, Corner Bistro, White Horse Tavern and Magnolia Bakery. With buildings dating back to the early 1700s and just the right degree of modern edges, the West Village remains one of the most desirable locales in the entire city. properties.neighborhood_overview: Flatiron is the most classic New York City neighborhood. It has the old city charm with glorious architecture and landmarks, the fabulous greenspace of Madison Square Park, and the breathtaking experience of Eataly gourmet market... all within a few steps of the building. On the corner is the famous sports bar / nightclub 40/40, owned by Jay Z. There are countless attractions, restaurants, galleries, clubs, venues, museums, cafes, etc all within a few blocks.
properties.transit: Its not possible to be more central than Flatiron. Literally in the heart of the city, in the center East-West and just South of midtown (Times Square - 20 blocks, the Empire State Building - 10 blocks).  N, Q, R, W, F, M, 1, 2, 4, 6 trains are within 2 blocks which takes you all over Manhattan. Union Square is 8 blocks south where you can catch the L train into Williamsburg or Bushwick, Brooklyn. The F train goes to Dumbo, Brooklyn. N or W will take you into Astoria, Queens. M train goes to other points in Queens. Of course yellow cabs and uber/lyft are beyond plentiful.

properties.neighborhood_overview: There are several large grocery stores within two blocks, as well as many neighborhood bodegas. You will also find delicious Mexican restaurants literally steps from the building's front door. The area is home to several public housing units, which give the neighborhood a true New Yorker family vibe. On weekends, take a walk to Thomas Jefferson Park on the East River to see all the family BBQs, as well as one the city's largest public pools.  I have lived  this area for years as a single woman, and I have always felt safe, even walking home from the train late at night. If you are not familiar with NYC, be assured, blocks like this one, which are filled with family units, are very safe. Folks say hello to one another o the sidewalks.

properties.neighborhood_overview: It is a really exciting time to live in Harlem. The neighborhood is changing by the minute. Every day there are new coffee shops, restaurants, and bars are opening their doors. Great soul food restaurants abound like the famous Syvia's. Red Rooster has been making a splash in the neighborhood as well. Shopping on 125th street is a fun way to spend an afternoon. a 10 minute walk to the famous Apolo Theatre. We are 20 blocks from Central Park and there are many historical attractions in the area. Within 2 minutes of the apt find plenty of bodegas, a Duane Reade pharmacy, banks, grocery stores, 24 hour laundromat, an AMC movie theatre, gyms and more.
properties.notes: This apt really feels like a home.
properties.transit: Getting to and from the apt is very easy. We are a 5 minute walk in either direction from the 2/3 train or the C/B train and another 5 minutes to the A/D train. You can be at Central Park, Lincoln Centre, Times Square, Hells Kitchen, The Time Warner Centre, within 15 minutes.  The M60 bus will drop you off 7 blocks away from the apt if you're coming from Laguardia Airport.  The A train can be taken directly from JFK.
properties.access: You will have access to a large beautifully decorated bedroom with a queen sized bed, ample closet space, and air conditioning. Pillows, sheets, and blankets are provided. You will also have use of your own private bathroom with a tub and shower. The spacious living room is yours to use as is our fully functional kitchen with dishwasher. The other two bedrooms in the apt are private.
properties.interaction: I will not be present during your stay. You will be sharing the apartment with my roommates Daniel and Matt. Both are gay men in their 30's. One teaches yoga the other is a theatre director and grad student. Everyone in our home is quiet, clean and are respectful professionals. I am accessible through email and via phone and if the dates work out, I will be the one to check you in to the apt.
properties.house_rules: We expect our guests to behave respectfully to the other people living in the apt and not to damage any of the walls, furnishings and fixtures. If something breaks you must immediately call or email me.  No pets other pets allowed.  No smoking in the apt. When leaving the apartment please leave strip the bed of all your sheets and leave them along with dirty towels in the laundry basket in the bathroom. Please empty the fridge of any food you have not used. Please empty the trash cans in the bedroom and your bathroom and leave it outside the building in the trash receptacles.  Leave the key on the credenza by the door unless otherwise arranged with me in advance.

properties.space: You can book on a weekly or monthly basis.  Large renovated studio apartment in the heart of Greenwich Village treelined streets, brownstone buildings. The apartment has a full size kitchenette, full size bathroom with a bathtub and ample storage space, and a charming garden in the buildings backyard. Accommodates 2 people comfortably with a King size round bed (yes it's round!), and a grey linen tufted sofa that converts into a bed. properties.space: The room is cozy and faces the courtyard so street noise is limited. The room can fit 2 people comfortably and has a closet. Comfortable full size bed. The building also offers roof access for amazing views of all of NYC including the Empire State Building, Freedom Tower and the Williamsburg, Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges.
